Package com.atakmap.map.layer.raster

Interface RasterLayer2

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Layer, Layer2
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataStoreRasterLayer2, AbstractRasterLayer2, DatasetRasterLayer2, MobileImageryRasterLayer2, NativeImageryRasterLayer2
    public interface RasterLayer2
extends Layer2
    Layer2 subinterface for raster data.

    Selection

    The RasterLayer manages a selection property. This property instructs the layer what content should currently be rendered. For very simple RasterLayer implementations, there may only be one selection value (e.g. a single image). More complex layers may contain multiple datasets and/or multiple imagery types providing potentially worldwide coverage. In this case, the selection may be used to explicitly request a single dataset or type be rendered (a "lock" function).

    Preferred Projection

    The RasterLayer exposes a preferred projection that is the Projection it currently would prefer to be displayed at. This value may be null in the event that the layer has no preference. The value may change periodically as it should be driven by the currently displayed data (i.e. selection changes).

    • Method Detail

      • setSelection

        void setSelection​(java.lang.String type)
        Specifies the selection to be displayed. If null, the layer will automatically select the imagery based on the current resolution.
        Parameters:
        type - The selection. Should be one of the values returned by getSelectionOptions().
        See Also:
        getSelectionOptions()

      • getSelection

        java.lang.String getSelection()
        Returns the current selection. If the layer is currently in auto-select mode, the value returned should be the content currently displayed. In the case where multiple content is displayed, the recommendation is to return the value for the top-most content.
        Returns:
        The current selection

      • isAutoSelect

        boolean isAutoSelect()
        Returns true if the layer is in auto-select mode, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the layer is in auto-select mode, false otherwise.

      • getSelectionOptions

        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getSelectionOptions()
        Returns the list of available selection options for all data contained in this layer. The available selection options are recommended to be a single logical index over the data (e.g. dataset names, imagery types).

        The null option is always implicit and does not need to be specified.

        Returns:
        The available selection options

        Returns:
        The coverage geometry associated with the specified selection

      • getPreferredProjection

        Projection getPreferredProjection()
        Returns the current preferred projection for the layer. This method will generally returned the native projection for the data that is currently being rendered. This value is expected to change if the current selection is manually or automatically updated.
        Returns:
        The current preferred projection for the layer
        See Also:
        addOnPreferredProjectionChangedListener(OnPreferredProjectionChangedListener)
